騎.definition: to sit astride; to ride (a horse, bike etc); classifier for saddle horses

騎劫.definition: to hijack (an airplane, motor vehicle, social media account, discussion etc)

騎士.definition: knight; cavalier; (Tw) bike rider (scooter, bicycle etc)

騎手.definition: horse rider; equestrian; jockey; bike rider

騎牆.definition: to sit on the fence (in a dispute)

騎田嶺.definition: Qitian mountain range between south Hunan and Guangdong

騎脖子拉屎.definition: lit. to take a dump while riding on sb's shoulders (saying); fig. to treat sb like garbage

騎虎難下.definition: if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway

騎行.definition: to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc); cycling; horseback riding; motorbike riding

騎警隊.definition: mounted police detachment (on horse or motorbike)

騎車.definition: to ride a bike (motorbike or bicycle)

騎馬找馬.definition: (idiom) (coll.) to continue in an unsatisfactory job (or romantic relationship etc) while actively looking for a better one

騎驢找馬.definition: (idiom) (coll.) to continue in an unsatisfactory job (or romantic relationship etc) while actively looking for a better one

騎驢找驢.definition: lit. to search for the mule while riding on it (idiom); fig. to look for what one already has

騎驢覓驢.definition: see 騎驢找驢|骑驴找驴[qi2 lu:2 zhao3 lu:2]

騎鶴.definition: to ride a crane (as a Daoist adept)

騎鶴上揚州.definition: lit. to ride a crane to Yangzhou (idiom); to get an official position
